intro: Katherinea elongata, commonly known as the slender katherinea, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and a prominent tube shape. Katherinea elongata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
